DataElement.preferredName: Derived Tumor Marker Squamous Cell Carcinoma Antigen Measurement Laboratory Test Result Age Day Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value to represent the age of the individual for the tumor marker lab results of the squamous cell carcinoma antigen, represented as a calculated age in days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Marker Squamous Cell Carcinoma Antigen Measurement Laboratory Test Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A substance that may be found in tumor tissue or released from a tumor into the blood or other body fluids. A high level of a tumor marker may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (in ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (in breast cancer), CEA (in ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (in prostate cancer)._The determination of the squamous cell carcinoma antigen present in a sample._The outcome of a laboratory test.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker.

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the squamous cell carcinoma antigen present in a sample.
The outcome of a laboratory test.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured, assigned or computed to describe an individual's age.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
